definition: hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
words/speech/to say/to talk
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: How am I doing? Well sometimes it's hard to tell.
sentences.chinese: 我生活得怎樣？有時真是一言難盡。

sentences.english: The desperation of the infertile would-be mother knows no bounds.
sentences.chinese: 那些不能生育的準媽媽們的絕望是一言難盡的。

sentences.english: Feminism's fine, but there's a lot to be said for having your bills paid.
sentences.chinese: 女權固然光彩，然而要用你的錢，真是一言難盡。

sentences.english: Talking about it is you really untold.
sentences.chinese: 說起它呀，真是一言難盡。

sentences.english: I want to say so much, but I can hardly find the words.
sentences.chinese: 我想說的有很多，但我真的一言難盡。

sentences.english: The English spelling system is 'absolutely, unspeakably awful'.
sentences.chinese: 英文拼寫系統“真是一言難盡的糟糕”。

sentences.english: 'English has an absolutely, unspeakably awful spelling system, ' said Bell, a former English teacher and author of the book Understanding English Spelling.
sentences.chinese: 英語這個語言的拼寫系統真是一言難盡的糟糕。

sentences.english: It's a long story. I'm afraid I can't tell you.
sentences.chinese: 真是一言難盡，恐怕我不能告訴你。

sentences.english: The story roots in a long story.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事的起源一言難盡。

definition: the hypocrisy of the world (idiom)
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to digress/to stray from the subject
to be at a loss for words/speechless
Heaven knows!
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
absolutely true (idiom)/manifold/true from many points of view
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
careless/casual/vague/not so bad/so-so/tolerable/fair
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
something to be taken up later in speech or writing
to die/euphemism, lit. to return West or to the Western Paradise
with complex feelings (idiom)
lit. to fish a needle from the sea/to find a needle in a haystack (idiom)
